titles.title: A bill to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to identify each alien who is serving, or has served, in the Armed Forces of the United States on the application of any such alien for an immigration benefit or the placement of any such alien in an immigration enforcement proceeding, and for other purposes.
I-VETS Act
Immigrant Veterans Eligibility Tracking System Act
Immigrant Veterans Eligibility Tracking System Act
I–VETS Act
Immigrant Veterans Eligibility Tracking System Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary:
Immigrant Veterans Eligibility Tracking System Act or the I-VETS Act
This bill requires the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to identify aliens who are serving or have served in the Armed Forces, when such an alien applies for an immigration benefit or is placed in an immigration enforcement proceeding. Such information shall be reflected in DHS records, and shall not be used to remove an alien from the United States.
